pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.5: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.1: When having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.2: One commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.3: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.4: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.5: when one inserts the penis without touching into a wide open mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.1: When stealing, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.2: One commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.3: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth five māsaka coins or more than five māsakas, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.4: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth more than one māsaka coin but less than five māsakas, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.5: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth one māsaka coin or less than one māsaka, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.1: When intentionally killing a human being, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.2: One commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.3: when one digs a pit for people, thinking, “Falling into it someone will die,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.4: when the person experiences pain after falling in, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.5: when the person dies, one commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.1: When untruthfully and groundlessly boasting about a superhuman quality, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.2: One commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.3: when, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.4: when one says, “Whatever monk lives in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.5: when the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:5.1: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.0: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.1: (…) When emitting semen by means of effort, one commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.2: when one intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.3: when one intends and makes an effort, but semen is not emitted, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.4: for the effort there is offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.1: When making physical contact with a woman, one commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.2: when one touches body with body, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.3: when one touches what is connected to the body with the body, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.4: when one touches what is connected to the body with what is connected to the body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.1: When speaking indecently to a woman, one commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.2: when, referring to the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.3: when, referring to any part below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.4: when, referring to anything connected to the body, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.1: When commending the satisfaction of one’s own desires, one commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.2: when one encourages a woman to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.3: when one encourages a paṇḍaka to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.4: when one encourages an animal to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.1: When acting as a matchmaker, one commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.2: when one accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.3: when one accepts the mission, and finds out the response, but does not report back, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.4: when one accepts the mission, but neither finds out the response, nor reports back, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.1: When having a hut built by means of begging, one commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.2: when one is having it built, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.1: When having a large dwelling built, one commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.2: when one is having it built, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.1: When groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.2: when, without having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.3: when, having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.1: When charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext, one commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.2: when, without having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.3: when, having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.1: When not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.1: When not stopping when pressed up to three times, monks who side with a monk who is pursuing schism commit three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.2: after the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.3: after each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.4: when the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.1: When not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is difficult to correct commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.1: When not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is a corrupter of families commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.3: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.4: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:19.1: The thirteen rules entailing suspension are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.0.2: 4.1 The sub-chapter on the robe-making season
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.1: When keeping an extra robe more than ten days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:21.1: When staying apart from one’s three robes for one day, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:21.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:22.1: When receiving out-of-season robe-cloth and then keeping it for more than a month, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:22.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.1: When having an unrelated nun wash a used robe, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.2: when one is having her wash it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.3: when one has had it washed, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.1: When receiving a robe directly from an unrelated nun, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.2: when one is in the process of taking it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.3: when one has taken it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.1: When asking an unrelated male or female householder for a robe, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.2: when one is in the process of asking, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.3: when one has asked, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.1: When asking an unrelated male or female householder for too many robes, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.2: when one is in the process of asking, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.3: when one has asked, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.1: When, without first being invited, going to an unrelated householder and specifying the kind of robe-cloth one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.2: when one is in the process of specifying it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.3: when one has specified it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.1: When, without first being invited, going to unrelated householders and specifying the kind of robe-cloth one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.2: when one is in the process of specifying it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.3: when one has specified it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.1: When getting robe-cloth after prompting more than three times and standing more than six times, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.2: when one is getting it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.3: when one has got it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:30.1: The first sub-chapter on the robe-making season is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.1: When having a blanket made that contains silk, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.2: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.1: When having a blanket made entirely of black wool, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.2: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.1: When having a new blanket made without using one measure of white wool and one measure of brown, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.2: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.1: When having a blanket made every year, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.2: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.1: When having a new sitting-blanket made without incorporating a piece of one standard handspan from the border of an old blanket, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.2: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.3: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.1: When receiving wool and then taking it more than 40 kilometers, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.2: when one goes further than 40 kilometers with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.3: when one goes beyond with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.1: When having an unrelated nun wash wool, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.2: when one is having her wash it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.3: when one has had it washed, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.1: When receiving money, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.2: when one is in the process of taking it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.3: when one has taken it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.1: When trading with money in various ways, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.2: when one is in the process of trading, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.3: when one has traded, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.1: When bartering in various ways, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.2: when one is in the process of bartering, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.3: when one has bartered, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:41.1: The second sub-chapter on silk is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:42.1: When keeping an extra almsbowl over ten days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:42.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.1: When exchanging an almsbowl with less than five mends for a new bowl, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.2: when one is in the process of exchanging it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.3: when one has exchanged it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:44.1: When receiving medicines and then keeping them for more than seven days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:44.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.1: When looking for a rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of the hot season, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.2: when one is in the process of looking for it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.3: when one has looked for it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.1: When giving away a robe to a monk and then taking it back in anger, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.2: when one is in the process of taking it back, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.3: when one has taken it back, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.1: When asking for thread and then having weavers weave robe-cloth, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.2: when one is having it woven, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.3: when one has had it woven, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.1: When going, without first being invited, to an unrelated householder’s weavers and then specifying the kind of robe-cloth one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.2: when one is in the process of specifying it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.3: when one has specified it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:49.1: When receiving a haste-cloth and then keeping it beyond the robe season, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:49.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:50.1: When storing one of one’s three robes in an inhabited area and then staying apart from it for more than six days, one commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:50.2: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.1: When diverting to oneself material support that one knows is intended for the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.2: when one is in the process of diverting it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.3: when one has diverted it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:52.1: The third sub-chapter on almsbowls is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:52.2: The thirty rules on relinquishment and confession are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.0.1: 5. The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.1: When lying in full awareness, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.2: When lying in full awareness, one commits five kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.3: when, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.4: when one groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.5: when one says, “Whatever monk lives in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.6: when the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.7: when one lies in full awareness, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.1: When speaking abusively, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.2: when one speaks abusively to one who is fully ordained, one commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.3: when one speaks abusively to one who is not fully ordained, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.1: When engaging in malicious talebearing, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.2: when one engages in malicious talebearing to one who is fully ordained, one commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.3: when one engages in malicious talebearing to one who is not fully ordained, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.1: When instructing a person who is not fully ordained to memorize the Teaching, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.2: when one is in the process of instructing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.3: for every line, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.1: When sleeping more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.2: when one is in the process of lying down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.3: when one is lying down, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.1: When sleeping in the same sleeping place as a woman, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.2: when one is in the process of lying down, then then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.3: when one is lying down, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.1: When giving a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.2: when one is in the process of teaching, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.3: for every line, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.1: When truthfully telling a person who is not fully ordained of a superhuman quality, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.2: when one is in the process of telling, then then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.3: when one has told, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.1: When telling a person who is not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.2: when one is in the process of telling, then then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.3: when one has told, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.1: When digging the earth, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.2: when one is in the process of digging, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.3: for every strike, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:63.1: The first sub-chapter on lying is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.1: When having plants felled, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.2: when one is having them felled, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.3: for every strike, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.1: When speaking evasively, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.2: when one speaks evasively without having been charged with evasive speech, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.3: when one speaks evasively after having been charged with evasive speech, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.1: When complaining about a monk, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.2: when one is in the process of complaining, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.3: when one has complained, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.1: When taking a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a bench belonging to the Sangha and putting it outside, and then departing without putting it away or informing anyone, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.2: when one goes beyond the distance of a stone-throw with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.3: when one goes beyond with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.1: When putting out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, and then departed without putting it away or informing anyone, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.2: when one crosses the boundary with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.3: when one crosses with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.1: When arranging one’s sleeping place, in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, in a way that encroaches on a monk that one knows arrived there before one, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.2: when one is in the process of lying down, then then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.3: when one is lying down, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.1: When angrily throwing a monk out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.2: when one is in the process of throwing him out, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.3: when one has thrown him out, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.1: When sitting down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.2: when one is in the process of sitting down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.3: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.1: When applying more than two or three courses, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.2: when one is in the process of applying them, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.3: when one has applied them, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.1: When intentionally killing a living being, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.2: When intentionally killing a living being, one commits four kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.5: when a spirit, ghost, or animal in human form falls into it and dies, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.6: when an animal falls into it and dies, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.1: When eating fresh or cooked food that was received directly from an unrelated nun who had entered an inhabited area, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.2: When eating fresh or cooked food that was received directly from an unrelated nun who had entered an inhabited area, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.3: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.4: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.1: When eating without having restrained a nun who is giving directions, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.1: When eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from families designated as “in training”, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.2: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.3: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.1: When eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside a wilderness monastery without first making an announcement, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.2: When eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside a wilderness monastery without first making an announcement, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.3: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.4: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:158.1: The four offenses entailing acknowledgment are finished.
